## capitalize() function

uppercases the first character in a string. in the case that the first character in the string can not be upper cased (for example a white space character or an empty string) the string is unmodified.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function capitalize(word: string): string;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  word | <code>string</code> | string to capitalize |

<b>Returns:</b>

`string`

the string with it's first character upper cased.
